subtopics.title: Gladiators
subtopics.description: Information about gladiatorial combat, including their social status, guilds, and the frequency of death in fights.

children.title: Gladiator Guilds
children.description: The organization of gladiators into guilds that provided support for their families.

children.title: Gladiator Origins
children.description: The changing demographics of gladiators from enslaved people to freemen seeking fame and fortune.

subtopics.title: Roman Clothing
subtopics.description: Details about typical Roman attire, including the toga, silk dresses, and laundry practices.

children.title: Togas
children.description: The ceremonial use of togas by male Roman citizens.

children.title: Silk Dresses
children.description: The popularity of flimsy Chinese silk dresses among upper-class Roman women.

children.title: Laundry Practices
children.description: The use of urine as a laundry detergent in ancient Rome.

subtopics.title: Roman Food and Drink
subtopics.description: Insights into Roman culinary habits, including the use of vomitoria, vegetarianism, and popular condiments.

children.title: Wanitoria
children.description: The misconception of wanitoria as rooms for vomiting after overeating.

children.title: Pythagorean Diet
children.description: The vegetarian beliefs of the Pythagoreans.

children.title: Garum
children.description: The popularity of garum, a sauce made from fermented fish guts.

subtopics.title: The Fall of the Roman Empire
subtopics.description: Discussion about the complexities of the Roman Empire's decline and its division into Eastern and Western halves.

children.title: Division of the Empire
children.description: The split of the Roman Empire into Eastern and Western halves.

children.title: Overthrow of Romulus Augustulus
children.description: The overthrow of the last Western Roman Emperor in 476 CE.

children.title: Byzantine Empire
children.description: The continuation of the Roman Empire in the East as the Byzantine Empire.
